plain_english_explanation: Policy and Procedures control ensures that clear guidelines are in place for managing security within an organization.
example_implementation: This script develop and regularly review policies and procedures that outline security protocols, access controls, and incident response plans to ensure compliance with NIST 800-53 standards.
non_technical_guidance: This plan develop and maintain policies and procedures that address the security requirements of the organization. This includes creating a policy document that outlines the security controls, procedures for implementing those controls, and guidelines for monitoring and enforcing compliance. Ensure that all employees are aware of these policies and procedures through regular training and communication. Regularly review and update the policies and procedures to reflect changes in the security landscape and organizational needs.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: This control requires organizational policy documentation and procedures. No technical automation available.

plain_english_explanation: Allocation of Resources is about making sure that resources like money, time, and people are used efficiently to support security activities.
example_implementation: This script prioritize security resources based on risk assessments to ensure that the most critical assets receive the appropriate level of protection.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan ensure that resources (such as personnel, equipment, facilities) are allocated effectively and efficiently to support the organization's security program. This can be achieved by:
1. Conducting regular assessments to determine resource needs and gaps.
2. Prioritizing resource allocation based on risk assessments and security priorities.
3. Implementing clear roles and responsibilities for individuals involved in security activities.
4. Providing adequate training and support to ensure resources are used effectively.
5. Monitoring resource usage and adjusting allocation as needed to address changing security requirements.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: This control requires manual implementation and verification. Automated scripts not applicable.

plain_english_explanation: The System Development Life Cycle control ensures that new IT systems are properly planned, designed, and tested before they are implemented.
example_implementation: This script make sure to follow a structured process for developing and deploying new IT systems, including requirements gathering, design, testing, and implementation phases. Regularly review and update the system development process to ensure it aligns with best practices and security standards.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan the System Development Life Cycle control (SA-3) is not directly implementable through automation. Instead, organizations can ensure compliance with this control by following these steps:

1. Establish a formal System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) process that includes defined phases such as planning, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
2. Document the SDLC process, including roles and responsibilities, deliverables, and approval processes for each phase.
3. Implement security considerations throughout the SDLC, such as incorporating security requirements into the design phase, conducting security testing during development, and performing security reviews before deployment.
4. Provide training and guidance to development teams on the SDLC process and security best practices.
5. Regularly review and update the SDLC process to incorporate lessons learned and changes in technology or regulations.

By following these steps, organizations can effectively implement and maintain compliance with the System Development Life Cycle control (SA-3) as outlined in NIST 800-53.

enhancements.title: Manage Preproduction Environment
enhancements.official_text: Protect system preproduction environments commensurate with risk throughout the system development life cycle for the system, system component, or system service.

official_text: Include the following requirements, descriptions, and criteria, explicitly or by reference, using {{ insert: param, sa-04_odp.01 }} in the acquisition contract for the system, system component, or system service:
plain_english_explanation: When acquiring a new system or service, make sure to include specific requirements, descriptions, and criteria in the contract.
example_implementation: This script ensure that the acquisition contract clearly outlines the security requirements and expectations for the system or service being acquired, to ensure compliance with NIST 800-53 standards.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to implement the Acquisition Process control (sa-4) in compliance with NIST 800-53, follow these steps:
1. Review the acquisition contract for the system, system component, or system service.
2. Ensure that the contract includes the requirements, descriptions, and criteria explicitly or by reference using the specified parameter (sa-04_odp.01).
3. If the contract does not currently include this information, work with legal and procurement teams to update the contract accordingly.
4. Regularly review and update acquisition contracts to ensure continued compliance with this control.
5. Document the inclusion of requirements, descriptions, and criteria in the acquisition contract for audit and compliance purposes.

enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide a description of the functional properties of the controls to be implemented.

plain_english_explanation: System Documentation control requires organizations to maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation for their IT systems.
example_implementation: This script creates a centralized repository for all system documentation, including network diagrams, configurations, and procedures, to ensure easy access and management. Regularly review and update documentation to reflect any changes in the IT environment.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to ensure compliance with SA-5 (System Documentation), follow these non-technical steps:
1. Establish a process for maintaining accurate and up-to-date system documentation.
2. Define the scope of system documentation required for your organization's systems.
3. Assign responsibility for creating, updating, and reviewing system documentation.
4. Implement a version control system to track changes to system documentation.
5. Regularly review and update system documentation to reflect changes in the system configuration or environment.
6. Ensure that system documentation is easily accessible to authorized personnel.
7. Train staff on the importance of maintaining system documentation and the procedures for updating it.
8. Conduct periodic audits to verify the completeness and accuracy of system documentation.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: This control requires manual implementation and verification. Automated scripts not applicable.

plain_english_explanation: This control ensures that software is only used for authorized purposes.
example_implementation: This script implement strict policies and procedures for software usage, including restricting access to only authorized users and regularly monitoring software usage.
non_technical_guidance: This plan to implement software usage restrictions, you should establish policies and procedures that define which software applications are allowed to be installed and used on systems within your organization. These policies should be communicated to all employees and enforced through regular audits and monitoring. Additionally, you should consider implementing application control solutions that restrict the execution of unauthorized software on endpoints. Regularly review and update the list of approved software to ensure compliance with organizational requirements.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.

plain_english_explanation: This control ensures that users cannot install unauthorized software on company devices to prevent security risks.
example_implementation: This script implement a software restriction policy that only allows approved software to be installed on company devices, and regularly monitor for any unauthorized installations.
non_technical_guidance: This plan to ensure compliance with control SA-7 regarding user-installed software, you should establish policies and procedures that restrict users from installing unauthorized software on their systems. This can be achieved by implementing application whitelisting, where only approved software can be installed on the systems. Regular monitoring and auditing of installed software should also be conducted to detect any unauthorized installations. Additionally, user training and awareness programs can educate users on the risks associated with installing unauthorized software and the importance of compliance with organizational policies.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.

official_text: Apply the following systems security and privacy engineering principles in the specification, design, development, implementation, and modification of the system and system components: {{ insert: param, sa-8_prm_1 }}.
plain_english_explanation: Ensure that security and privacy principles are incorporated into all stages of system development.
example_implementation: This script conduct regular security and privacy reviews throughout the development process to ensure that all principles are being followed.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to comply with SA-8 (Security and Privacy Engineering Principles), organizations should incorporate the following systems security and privacy engineering principles into the specification, design, development, implementation, and modification of systems and system components:

1. Privacy by Design: Ensure that privacy is considered throughout the entire system development lifecycle. This includes implementing privacy controls, minimizing data collection, and ensuring data protection measures are in place.

2. Least Privilege: Limit access to system resources to only those necessary for users to perform their job functions. This principle helps reduce the risk of unauthorized access and data breaches.

3. Defense-in-Depth: Implement multiple layers of security controls to protect systems and data. This includes network segmentation, encryption, intrusion detection systems, and regular security monitoring.

4. Secure Development Practices: Follow secure coding practices and conduct regular security testing to identify and remediate vulnerabilities in software applications.

5. Resilience and Redundancy: Design systems with resilience and redundancy in mind to ensure continuity of operations in the event of a cyber incident or disaster.

By incorporating these principles into the system development process, organizations can enhance the security and privacy posture of their systems and better protect sensitive information from unauthorized access or disclosure.

plain_english_explanation: Ensure that external system services are identified, authorized, monitored, and controlled to prevent unauthorized access or misuse.
example_implementation: This script regularly review and update the list of authorized external system services, and implement access controls to restrict access to only approved services.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to comply with control SA-9 "External System Services," the following non-technical implementation plan can be followed:

1. Identify and document all external system services that are used within the organization.
2. Evaluate the security controls and protections provided by each external system service provider.
3. Ensure that contracts or agreements with external system service providers include provisions for security requirements, data protection, and compliance with organizational policies.
4. Regularly review and monitor the security posture of external system services to ensure they continue to meet security requirements.
5. Implement a process for promptly addressing any security incidents or vulnerabilities related to external system services.
6. Train employees on the proper use and security considerations when interacting with external system services.
7. Periodically review and update the list of approved external system services to reflect changes in usage or security posture.

By following this implementation plan, organizations can effectively manage and secure their use of external system services in compliance with control SA-9.

official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:
plain_english_explanation: Developers must manage and control changes to the configuration of the system they are working on.
example_implementation: This script implement a version control system, such as Git, to track changes made by developers and ensure proper documentation and approval processes are followed for configuration changes.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to implement Developer Configuration Management for compliance with control sa-10, the following non-technical steps should be taken:
1. Establish clear guidelines and policies for developers regarding configuration management.
2. Require developers to use version control systems (e.g., Git) for managing code changes.
3. Implement code review processes to ensure changes are properly documented and approved.
4. Enforce access controls to restrict unauthorized changes to configurations.
5. Provide training and resources to developers on best practices for configuration management.
6. Regularly audit and review developer configurations to ensure compliance with established policies.

enhancements.title: Software and Firmware Integrity Verification
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to enable integrity verification of software and firmware components.

enhancements.title: Alternative Configuration Management Processes
enhancements.official_text: Provide an alternate configuration management process using organizational personnel in the absence of a dedicated developer configuration management team.

enhancements.title: Hardware Integrity Verification
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to enable integrity verification of hardware components.

enhancements.title: Trusted Generation
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to employ tools for comparing newly generated versions of security-relevant hardware descriptions, source code, and object code with previous versions.

enhancements.title: Mapping Integrity for Version Control
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to maintain the integrity of the mapping between the master build data describing the current version of security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware and the on-site master copy of the data for the current version.

enhancements.title: Trusted Distribution
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to execute procedures for ensuring that security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware updates distributed to the organization are exactly as specified by the master copies.

official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service, at all post-design stages of the system development life cycle, to:
plain_english_explanation: Developers must test and evaluate their system throughout its development to ensure it meets security requirements.
example_implementation: This script implement automated testing tools and conduct regular code reviews to catch security vulnerabilities early in the development process.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan 1. Establish clear guidelines and procedures for developers to conduct thorough testing and evaluation of their code at all post-design stages of the system development life cycle.
2. Provide training and resources to developers on best practices for testing and evaluating their code, including unit testing, integration testing, and security testing.
3. Implement a code review process where developers can peer-review each other's code to ensure quality and identify potential issues.
4. Define metrics and criteria for evaluating the effectiveness of developer testing and evaluation processes.
5. Regularly monitor and assess developer compliance with testing and evaluation requirements, providing feedback and support as needed.
6. Document all testing and evaluation activities for auditing and compliance purposes.

enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to employ static code analysis tools to identify common flaws and document the results of the analysis.

plain_english_explanation: Supply Chain Protection ensures that the software and hardware components used in an organization's IT systems are secure and free from vulnerabilities introduced by third-party suppliers.
example_implementation: This script conduct thorough security assessments and due diligence on all third-party vendors before integrating their products into your IT environment. Regularly monitor and update supply chain security measures to protect against potential threats.
non_technical_guidance: This plan establish and maintain a supply chain risk management program that includes processes for vetting suppliers, ensuring the integrity of software and hardware, and monitoring for potential supply chain threats. This program should include regular assessments, audits, and security reviews of suppliers and their products. Additionally, implement contractual requirements for suppliers to adhere to security standards and practices. Regularly review and update supply chain security policies and procedures to address emerging threats and vulnerabilities.

plain_english_explanation: Trustworthiness control ensures that only authorized individuals have access to sensitive information and systems.
example_implementation: This script regularly review and update access controls to ensure that only authorized users have access to sensitive data and systems. Conduct regular audits to identify and address any unauthorized access.
non_technical_guidance: This plan to ensure trustworthiness in your system, you should establish and maintain a culture of security awareness and accountability within your organization. This can be achieved by implementing security training and awareness programs for all employees, conducting regular security assessments and audits, enforcing security policies and procedures, and promoting a culture of transparency and accountability. Additionally, you should regularly monitor and review access controls, permissions, and user activities to detect and respond to any unauthorized or suspicious behavior. By fostering a culture of trustworthiness, you can enhance the overall security posture of your organization.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.

plain_english_explanation: Criticality Analysis involves determining the importance of information systems and their components to the organization's mission and business functions.
example_implementation: This script conduct a thorough assessment of the criticality of each system and component to prioritize security measures and resources effectively.
non_technical_guidance: This plan perform a criticality analysis of the information system to determine the impact levels of potential security incidents. This analysis should consider the potential harm to organizational operations, organizational assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation. Document the results of the analysis and use it to inform risk management decisions and prioritize security controls implementation. Update the criticality analysis periodically to account for changes in the system or threat landscape.

enhancements.title: Critical Components with No Viable Alternative Sourcing

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.

control_name: Critical Components with No Viable Alternative Sourcing

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.

plain_english_explanation: This control ensures that a standardized development process, tools, and standards are in place to help create secure software and systems.
example_implementation: This script establish a clear and documented development process that includes security requirements, use secure coding standards, and utilize tools like static code analysis to identify and fix security vulnerabilities early in the development lifecycle.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to ensure compliance with sa-15 (Development Process, Standards, and Tools), the following non-technical implementation plan can be followed:

1. Establish clear development process guidelines and standards that align with NIST 800-53 requirements.
2. Provide training and awareness sessions for developers on the established standards and tools.
3. Implement code review processes to ensure adherence to the standards.
4. Utilize version control systems to track changes and maintain code integrity.
5. Regularly update development tools and technologies to meet security and compliance requirements.
6. Conduct periodic audits and assessments to verify compliance with the established standards.
7. Document and maintain records of the development process, standards, and tools for audit purposes.

By following these steps, organizations can effectively implement and maintain compliance with sa-15 without the need for automation.

enhancements.title: Quality Metrics
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:

enhancements.title: Security and Privacy Tracking Tools
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to select and employ security and privacy tracking tools for use during the development process.

enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to perform a criticality analysis:

enhancements.title: Attack Surface Reduction
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to reduce attack surfaces to {{ insert: param, sa-15.05_odp }}.

enhancements.title: Continuous Improvement
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to implement an explicit process to continuously improve the development process.

enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service {{ insert: param, sa-15.07_odp.01 }} to:

enhancements.title: Reuse of Threat and Vulnerability Information
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to use threat modeling and vulnerability analyses from similar systems, components, or services to inform the current development process.

enhancements.title: Incident Response Plan
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide, implement, and test an incident response plan.

enhancements.title: Archive System or Component
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system or system component to archive the system or component to be released or delivered together with the corresponding evidence supporting the final security and privacy review.

enhancements.title: Minimize Personally Identifiable Information
enhancements.official_text: Require the developer of the system or system component to minimize the use of personally identifiable information in development and test environments.

official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide the following training on the correct use and operation of the implemented security and privacy functions, controls, and/or mechanisms: {{ insert: param, sa-16_odp }}.
plain_english_explanation: Developers must provide training on how to correctly use the security and privacy functions of a system.
example_implementation: This script ensure developers provide thorough training sessions and materials to all users of the system to ensure proper understanding and utilization of security features.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to comply with Control ID sa-16 (Developer-provided Training), the following non-technical implementation plan can be followed:

1. Identify the developers responsible for the system, system component, or system service in question.
2. Establish a training program that covers the correct use and operation of the implemented security and privacy functions, controls, and mechanisms.
3. Schedule regular training sessions for developers to ensure they are up to date on security and privacy best practices.
4. Provide resources and materials to support the training program, such as documentation, videos, or online courses.
5. Require developers to demonstrate their understanding of the training material through assessments or practical exercises.
6. Keep records of developer training completion and periodically review and update the training program as needed.
7. Ensure that new developers joining the team receive the necessary training before working on the system or component.
8. Encourage developers to ask questions and seek clarification on security and privacy-related matters.

By following this implementation plan, organizations can ensure that developers are adequately trained on the security and privacy functions of the system, component, or service they are working on, thereby enhancing overall compliance with sa-16.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.

control_name: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design
official_text: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to produce a design specification and security and privacy architecture that:
plain_english_explanation: Developers must create a design plan for how security and privacy will be built into the system.
example_implementation: This script encourage developers to involve security and privacy experts early in the design process to ensure that all potential risks are identified and addressed from the beginning.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to implement control SA-17 for Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design, the following non-technical steps can be taken:

1. Establish a clear process for developers to produce design specifications and security and privacy architecture for the system, component, or service they are developing.
2. Provide training and resources to developers on best practices for incorporating security and privacy into their designs.
3. Require regular reviews and updates of design specifications and security architecture to ensure they remain effective and up-to-date.
4. Implement a process for verifying that design specifications and security architecture align with organizational security policies and standards.
5. Document all design specifications and security architecture for audit and compliance purposes.
6. Incorporate security and privacy considerations into the development lifecycle, from design to implementation to testing.
7. Encourage collaboration between developers, security teams, and privacy officers to ensure a holistic approach to security and privacy in the design process.

By following these steps, organizations can ensure that developers are producing secure and privacy-aware designs for their systems, components, and services.

plain_english_explanation: Tamper Resistance and Detection ensures that systems are protected from physical tampering or unauthorized access attempts.
example_implementation: This script implement physical security measures such as locks, alarms, and surveillance cameras to prevent and detect any tampering with critical systems.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan implementing tamper resistance and detection involves physical and logical controls to prevent unauthorized access, modification, or destruction of information systems. Here are some non-technical steps to achieve compliance with SA-18:

1. Implement physical security measures such as access controls, surveillance cameras, and alarm systems to protect the physical integrity of information systems.
2. Utilize encryption techniques to protect data at rest and in transit, making it difficult for unauthorized individuals to tamper with sensitive information.
3. Implement strict access controls and user permissions to limit the number of individuals who can make changes to the system.
4. Conduct regular audits and monitoring of system logs to detect any unauthorized changes or tampering attempts.
5. Provide training to employees on the importance of tamper resistance and detection, including recognizing suspicious behavior and reporting incidents promptly.

By following these steps, organizations can enhance their tamper resistance and detection capabilities to comply with SA-18 requirements.

plain_english_explanation: Component Authenticity ensures that all hardware and software components used in the system are genuine and not counterfeit.
example_implementation: This script verify the authenticity of all components by only purchasing from trusted vendors and conducting regular audits of your supply chain.
non_technical_guidance: This plan ensure that all software components acquired from external sources are digitally signed using a valid certificate issued by a trusted Certificate Authority. Implement a process to verify the authenticity of the software components before deployment. This can be done by maintaining a whitelist of trusted software vendors and regularly checking for updates and patches from these vendors. Additionally, establish a secure software development lifecycle that includes code reviews, vulnerability assessments, and secure coding practices to prevent the introduction of malicious code into the software components. Regularly monitor for unauthorized changes to software components and investigate any anomalies promptly.

official_text: Reimplement or custom develop the following critical system components: {{ insert: param, sa-20_odp }}.
plain_english_explanation: Develop important system components from scratch or customize existing ones to meet specific needs.
example_implementation: This script ensure that developers have a clear understanding of the critical components that need to be customized and provide adequate resources and support for the development process.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to comply with control SA-20, Customized Development of Critical Components, the following non-technical implementation plan can be followed:

1. Identify critical system components that need to be reimplemented or custom developed based on the organization's security requirements.
2. Evaluate the existing off-the-shelf solutions and determine if they meet the security needs of the organization. If not, consider custom development.
3. Develop a plan for the customized development of critical components, including defining requirements, design, implementation, testing, and deployment.
4. Ensure that the development process follows secure coding practices and incorporates security controls to mitigate potential vulnerabilities.
5. Conduct thorough testing and validation of the custom-developed components to ensure they function as intended and meet security requirements.
6. Implement the custom-developed components in the production environment and monitor them regularly for any security issues or vulnerabilities.
7. Document the custom development process, including design decisions, security controls implemented, and testing results for audit and compliance purposes.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.

official_text: Require that the developer of {{ insert: param, sa-21_odp.01 }}:
plain_english_explanation: Before hiring a developer, make sure to screen their background and qualifications to ensure they are trustworthy and capable of handling sensitive information.
example_implementation: This script conduct thorough background checks, including reference checks and verification of qualifications, before hiring developers to work on projects involving sensitive data.
non_technical_guidance: This plan to implement the Developer Screening control (sa-21), the organization should establish a formal process for screening developers before they are granted access to sensitive systems or data. This process should include background checks, reference checks, verification of qualifications, and any other necessary steps to ensure that developers are trustworthy and capable of handling the responsibilities associated with their roles. Additionally, the organization should regularly review and update this screening process to adapt to changing threats and requirements.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.
Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.

plain_english_explanation: Ensure that all system components are supported by the vendor to receive necessary security updates and patches.
example_implementation: This script regularly review vendor support agreements and documentation to ensure that all system components are still supported and receiving necessary updates.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to address the control for Unsupported System Components (sa-22), the following non-technical implementation plan can be followed:

1. Regularly review the list of system components in use within the organization's IT infrastructure.
2. Identify any components that are no longer supported by the vendor or manufacturer.
3. Develop a plan to replace or upgrade the unsupported components with supported alternatives.
4. Implement a process for monitoring and verifying that only supported system components are in use within the organization.
5. Document the process and keep records of the supported system components in use.
6. Periodically review and update the list of supported system components to ensure ongoing compliance with this control.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.
Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.

official_text: Employ {{ insert: param, sa-23_odp.01 }} on {{ insert: param, sa-23_odp.02 }} supporting mission essential services or functions to increase the trustworthiness in those systems or components.
plain_english_explanation: Specialization involves using specific security measures on systems supporting critical services to enhance their trustworthiness.
example_implementation: This script identify mission essential services or functions within your organization and implement specialized security measures to ensure the reliability and security of those systems.
non_technical_guidance: This plan to comply with control sa-23, ensure that specialized security controls are implemented on systems supporting mission essential services or functions. This can be achieved by conducting a thorough assessment of the systems and identifying the specific security controls needed to increase trustworthiness. Work closely with security experts to determine the appropriate specialized controls required for each system. Regularly review and update these controls to ensure they remain effective in enhancing the trustworthiness of the systems.

cac_metadata.implementation_guidance: Automated implementation planned but not yet available in ComplianceAsCode repository.
